fields.description:
JIRA RPC is badly broken due to the 3.12.1 version of the JIRA rpc plugin being installed in JIRA 3.13.

This means JIRA Buddy won't work with JIRA Studio until it's fixed :(
fields.summary: JIRA RPC broken

fields.description:
Subscribe to Crowd notifier so it will notify Confluence on user changes. Possible ways to do that:
* confluence upgrade task (there is a problem that only sysadmin can subscribe to notifications, but crowd doesn't support trusted apps, so it's not easy to make call as sysadmin)
* changing initial data in crowd so it will contain subscription from Confluence (that will get around sysadmin problem but there can be an issues with locating Confluence url - crowd doesn't know where confluence is)
* crowd upgrade task (would require including plugin upgrade framework in Crowd and have a problem with locating Confluence )

Create ResourceHandler that listens to crowd changes and  resets Crowd cache.
fields.summary: Reset crowd cache in Confluence when users are added/removed in Crowd

fields.description:
Use current Fisheye Notifier plugin and change it to Generic notifier. 
* Implement Fisheye version that replaces current Fishey notifier - update studio build. 
* Implement Crowd version that will allow to listen/subscribe to user changes in crowd
fields.summary: Implement Atlassian Notifier

fields.description:
We need to implement SAL interfaces PluginSettings and PluginSettingsFactory in sal-crowd-plugin. For that we need a way to store some data in crowd (something like Bandana in Confluence or PropertySet in Jira)

This task involves:
* Implement storage in Crowd
* Release studio-version of Crowd and update build to use latest version
* Implement sal-crowd plugin and update build to include it in studio-crowd
fields.summary: Implement storage of SAL's PluginSettings in Crowd
Upgrade to Crowd 1.5.2

fields.description: Only a sysadmin can create a project, admins can not.
fields.summary: Only Sysadmins can create projects

fields.description: Commit commands to change workflow should not be case sensitive.
fields.summary: svn commit commands should not be case sensitive

fields.description:
Studio lets users associate any Confluence space with a JIRA project, with this item on the JIRA project admin page:

!applinks_updateconfluence_synch.png!

One would click "Select", and enter the new Confluence space key on the subsequent screen:

!applinks_updateconfluence.png!

Then there is this mysterious "Synchronize" link.  This is actually responsible for propagating the change to Confluence and other apps.  If this is not clicked, then the change will only appear in the JIRA project drop-down, not in Confluence.

When there is a 1-1 relationship between the apps, then you always want to click "Synchronize" afterwards.  Since it's so important, rather than have a separate link, I think we should have a checkbox, checked by default, in the "update applink" screen:

!applinks_updateconfluence_new.png!

Perhaps we could have some blurb explaining that you only _wouldn't_ check this if you have multiple JIRA projects associated with 1 Confluence space, and don't want this project to be linked to from Confluence.
fields.summary: Make applinks synchronization the default, rather than an extra step

fields.description: Currently Studio insists that Subversion projects be a) top level, b) UPPERCASE.  Some customers have existing Subversion repositories where projects are not top-level. These customers have to either restructure their Subversion repository, or go without being able to adjust Subversion access permissions.
fields.summary: Allow non-standard Subversion project paths

fields.description:
Confluence 2.10 m5 broke jiraportletmacro. There is a test TestConfluenceJiraPortletMacro.class that we had to comment out to prevent functional tests from failing. 

jiraportletmacro seems to be already fixed: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-13539

Uncomment the test and make sure it pass, once we upgrade to Confluence 2.10-m7
fields.summary: Test Confluence's jiraportletmacro

fields.description: Category: $projectCategory.getString('name') is the text on the StAC homepage.

fields.description:
Update the refactoring spec to include details from Friday's meeting and focus on specifically on performance.
* section on existing performance bottlenecks, what the refactoring will address, other ways to improve
* description of exactly what data is expected to be retrieved

As an additional section, add broad estimates to complete the work around these features:
* Streams comments
* Multi-project select
* Multi-user select
* 'less' link
* Confluence Macro (including ensuring space/project equivalance)

Finally, review the OpenSocial spec and make any recommendations regarding required fields in order to have potential future compatability with Streams.
fields.summary: Update/Expand streams refactoring spec

fields.description: This is just an issue that I'm creating now so we don't forget, when we upgrade to JIRA 4.0 and JIRA FishEye plugin 3.0, we will need to move the commit notification stuff from the studio version of the jira fisheye plugin into the jira fisheye plugin.
fields.summary: Move commit notifications into jira fisheye plugin

fields.description:
When more than one copy of an attachment is added to a page, Confluence stores the old versions behind a drop-down:
!attachmentdropdown.png!

In the Confluence bundled with Studio 1.4.1 this drop-down doesn't work, and a javascript error appears in the error console:

Error: $ is not a function
Source File: http://test.jira.com/wiki/s/1419/6/_/includes/js/scriptaculous/lib/prototype.js
Line: 814
fields.summary: Confluence multiple attachment drop-down doesn't work

fields.description: Say I want some users to only be able to see a subset of projects.  This is almost possible to achieve by [adjusting permissions|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Managing+Users+and+Groups#ManagingUsersandGroups-Restrictingprojectvisibility] - none of the apps reveals project info - but browsing to http://<host>.jira.com/svn/ still shows a Subversion directory listing containing all the project keys. The user will only be able to access those links they have permission to, but sometimes even just the name is revealing too much info.
fields.summary: Subversion directory list reveals all project names to users

fields.description: Contegix already keeps database and filesystem backups, so the daily XML backups of JIRA and Confluence are redundant, slow things down and sometimes cause chaos by filling up the disk. They should be disabled in new images.
fields.summary: Disable JIRA Confluence daily backups in new Studio deployments

fields.description:
Users who have selected 'remember me' when logging into Studio are kept logged in when later returning to JIRA or Conf, but not FE/Cru.

Allow 'remember me' by adding a filter to fisheye that recognises JIRAs seraph cookie.
fields.summary: Make FishEye 'remember me'

fields.description:
Damn you, UI designers!

Studio used to have a straightforward "Administration" link in the corner.  In 1.4 I now have to click my username and select "Administration" from a drop-down:

!eviljavascriptiness.png!

This has numerous practical disadvantages:
 - It is totally non-obvious that the Admin menu link would be hiding behind my username.
 - I can no longer user Firefox '/' to find and click the link. Instead I have to resort to 2 mouseclicks (previously 1).
 - There is now no possibility of adding an access key. With vanilla JIRA I can press ctrl-shift-A and go to the administration section, but now it's all hiding behind Javascript this is impossible.
 - We just killed accessibility for any disabled people, and people using lynx.
fields.summary: Administration link hidden behind Javascript frippery

fields.description: Add 'Help Documentation' link to footer
fields.summary: Add 'Help Documentation' to footer

Also, it should explain what a "Header Menu Indicator Image" is, since it is far from obvious (see also AOD-1223).

Tom has written a [Crucible plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Crucible+Plugin] for Confluence, which looks like it would complement Studio's features. We should see if we can add it.

Two problems:

 - Is there a team willing to assume long-term maintenance?

{userlister|groups=*|online=true} ought to display a list of online users, assuming the "User Log in Listener" plugin module is enabled.

In Studio it just displays: 

No results were found for groups : Developer, administrators, ....

This macro works ([partly|http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/USERLISTER-9]) in Confluence 2.9.2, so apparently something specific to Studio is breaking it.

Studio Admin, User browser, and Application Links pages all show all tabs including hidden tabs.

fields.description:
JIRA 3.13 has a new "Create Shared Objects" permission which we grant only to the 'developers' group. Anyone not in this group who tries to edit the default dashboard will get an error:

!savedefaultportlet_error.png!

Anyone getting past that will then hit [further problems|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15766]. The only real solution for now is to grant that permission to the user's groups.
fields.summary: Users not in 'developers' group cannot edit default dashboard or some portlets

fields.description:
Add documentation for email to issue and email to issue comment functionality for the Issues application.

{quote}We now support email to ticket and email to comment functionality. Comment by email is enabled by default, but issue creation must be enabled per customer - customers should file a ticket to say they would like it enabled.

JIRA email notifications will be coming from jira@<accountname>.jira.com, and replying to this address will result in a comment on that issue.

As for creating issues, the customer must provide aPOP/IMAP account we can query (over SSL preferably), then we create a JIRA service that creates issues from it.{quote}

=> TO DO: Add a new page to the [Configuration FAQ|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Configuration+FAQ], e.g. 'How do I enable issues to be created via email?'
=> TO DO: Add a new page to the [Usage FAQ|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Usage+FAQ], e.g.'How do I create issues or issue comments via email?' Reference this JIRA doc page: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/issue_creation_email.html
=> TO DO: Update [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Restricted+Functions+in+JIRA+Studio], as POP/IMAP is no longer a restricted function.
fields.summary: Add documentation for email to issue and email to issue comment functionality

fields.summary: Add 'Filters' to JIRA sub nav

fields.description:
Studio lets a JIRA project be associated with a Subversion subdirectory on this screen:

!project_svn.png!

Unfortunately there is no validation on what is entered for the project name. If something invalid is entered, then later the SVN permission manager breaks if that project is configured with:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.studio.repository.svn.SvnRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.getSvnPathForJiraProject(SvnRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.studio.repository.svn.SvnRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.getPermissions(SvnRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.studio.repository.DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl$1.call(DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.studio.repository.DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl$1.call(DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.studio.repository.DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl$ExecutionQueue.execute(DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.java:192)
	at com.atlassian.studio.repository.DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.getPermissions(DelegatingRepositoryPermissionsManagerImpl.java:66)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.ProjectRepositoryPermissions.doExecute(ProjectRepositoryPermissions.java:63)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:153)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
{noformat}

We should either validate the input better, or print a decent error message instead of a NPE.
fields.summary: More validation needed when configuring project Subversion link

fields.description: When creating a project, the post-creation screen said that the FishEye repository creation had failed, but in actual fact it hadn't. It should be accurate.
fields.summary: Project creation is buggered

The brokenness no longer shows when a project is created.

fields.description: In Fisheye's /data/jirastudio/fisheye/data/config.xml, Crowd's server URL is still https rather than http, which is having a small performance impact.
fields.summary: Fisheye should use Crowd over http, not https

fields.description:
The Left Navigation theme for Confluence is very popular, and almost essential for certain uses (eg. product documentation).  Unfortunately we cannot enable alternate themese like it, because the Studio shared menus and look and feel are implemented as a Confluence theme.

The next best thing would be to have a Studio variation of the Left Nav theme, containing both Studio customizations and the left nav functionality.
fields.summary: Studio version of the Left Navigation theme

fields.description:
Users are reporting getting errors with the jiraissues Confluence macro:

rss: Unable to retrieve http://${host}.jira.com/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/FOO-1/FOO-1.xml: External connections have been disabled

In Confluence's general configuration page, there is a setting:

External connections enabled :	false

This should be *true* by default.
fields.summary: Confluence "External connections enabled" being continually reset to false by General Configuration edits

fields.description: We had a customer who had a problem with license loading. They wanted to increase the number of collaborators, but after loading their new license, through the admin screen, the changes didn't take effect. We need to figure out why and whether this is a cache timing thing that needs to be communicated to the user (e.g. have something that says "Your license changes will take effect in 10 mins" or something), or whether the license autoloading is broken.
fields.summary: Review license loading
search bar positioned wrong

fields.description: prevent end users from accessing the Plugins page, so that enabling a plugin requires Atlassian staff intervention, providing us an opportunity to impress upon people the risks (and perhaps suggest a better alternative).

fields.description: Adding users in Studio does not cause them to appear in the Confluence People Directory.  They only appear when the user has first edited Confluence content (and even then, only after 30 minutes due to AOD-1168).
fields.summary: Newly created users do not appear in the Confluence people directory

fields.description:
In WEB-INF/classes/crowd-ehcache.xml we cache Crowd hits for 30 minutes:

{code:xml}
    <defaultCache
        maxElementsInMemory="50000"
        eternal="false"
        overflowToDisk="false"
        timeToIdleSeconds="1800"
        timeToLiveSeconds="1800"
        diskPersistent="false"
        diskExpiryThreadIntervalSeconds="120"/>
{code}

30 minutes seems excessive given that Studio hosts typically have <50 users which should be quick to retrieve from a Crowd running on the same server.

It means that if a new user is added, but a user list has been previously cached, the application won't see the new user for 30 minutes. This is causing much confusion and annoyance.
fields.summary: Confluence user cache timeout of 30m is too long

fields.description:
On test.jira.com, as a developer, and in a project - If you are on issues tab, all 4 default tabs are visible.
If you are on wiki tab - only issue and wiki are visible.
If you are on source tab - only issues and source are visible.
If you are on review tab - only issues, source, and review are visible.

 Show stopper for 1.4 release.
fields.summary: Tabs disappearing on test.jira.com
Collaborator "no permissions" page unfriendly

fields.description:
Please fix. 
Also consider not to allow disabling all tabs
fields.summary: Hiding all tabs causes nav/search bar to grow

fields.description:
Collaborator can view & create reviews via activity stream - can also view F/E.  F/E and Cruc tabs become visible and accessible once accessed through Activity Stream.
